page.title: 19St.Michaels School:Tavistock
page.content: The school was started by Miss Ashwin in Whitchurch in a house called Greystones.It was then called St. Aubyns and was a girls only school. Then the school was bought by two Misses Raymond and another building bought in Devonport which was called St. Michael's Lodge and boys were admitted.As the school was in both buildings some of the staff went by train from Tavistock to Plymouth during the lunch hour.About 1930 the school was divied into two separate schools.In 1933 Miss Potts became headmistress of the Tavistock school and it moved to Plymouth Road.Miss Gilbert,a teacher at St.Michael's,was a pupil there when Miss Potts was headmistress.Miss Gilbert remembers that they were taught subjects no longer taught such as geolgy,Greek History and eurhythmics.
